Class BoardModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • BoardModel

  • public class BoardModel
extends java.lang.Object
    The BoardModel class contains all the data used by the Mancala game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoardModel()
      Constructs BoardModel by initializing arrays for storing pit data and view ChangeListeners, a HashMap for storing opposite pit paris, an array of undos remaing for each player, an int storing the current player, and flags used to determine if an undo is appropriate.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkIfGameOver()
      Sums up both players' pit counts independently to determine if the game is finished -- moves the remaining stones on the other player's side to their mancala if so.
      int getCurrentPlayer()
      Yields the current player.
      int[] getPits()
      Yields an array of ints representing the stone count in each pit.
      void initializePits(int numStones)
      Initialized the array of ints that represent the stone count in each pit.
      void initOpposites()
      Initialized the HashMap used to find opposite pit pairs.
      void notifyViews()
      Triggers the stateChanged action for the views' ChangeListener.
      void registerView(javax.swing.event.ChangeListener l)
      Attaches a view's ChangeListener to the model.
      void takeTurn(int id)
      Performs Mancala game's logic to complete a turn.
      void undo()
      Determines if it is appropraite for an undo action to take place.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • takeTurn

        public void takeTurn(int id)
        Performs Mancala game's logic to complete a turn.
        Parameters:

      • checkIfGameOver

        public void checkIfGameOver()
        Sums up both players' pit counts independently to determine if the game is finished -- moves the remaining stones on the other player's side to their mancala if so.
